title: What causes opioid addiction, and why is it so tough to combat? - Mike Davis

title: Which is better: Soap or hand sanitizer? - Alex Rosenthal and Pall Thordarson

multiple-choice.question: What are two simple ways to prevent the virus from infecting you when you touch your face?

options.label: A
options.text: Wearing gloves and using a face mask

options.label: B
options.text: Using soap and water, and hand sanitizer

options.label: C
options.text: Washing your hands with hot water and using hand sanitizer

options.label: D
options.text: Using a disinfectant spray and wearing a face shield

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between soap and hand sanitizer in terms of how they work?

options.label: A
options.text: Soap is more effective at killing the virus, while hand sanitizer is faster

options.label: B
options.text: Soap works like a crowbar, breaking up the virus's membrane, while hand sanitizer works like an earthquake, destabilizing the virus

options.label: C
options.text: Soap is more effective at removing dirt and debris, while hand sanitizer is more effective at killing the virus

options.label: D
options.text: Soap is more convenient to use, while hand sanitizer is more effective

multiple-choice.question: What is the hydrophobic effect, and how does it affect the virus's membrane?

options.label: A
options.text: The hydrophobic effect is a force that attracts water to the virus's membrane, making it stronger

options.label: B
options.text: The hydrophobic effect is a force that repels water from the virus's membrane, making it weaker

options.label: C
options.text: The hydrophobic effect is a force that has no effect on the virus's membrane

options.label: D
options.text: The hydrophobic effect is a force that attracts water to the virus's membrane, making it weaker

multiple-choice.question: What is the main benefit of using soap and water to wash your hands?

options.label: A
options.text: It is more convenient to use than hand sanitizer

options.label: B
options.text: It is more effective at killing the virus than hand sanitizer

options.label: C
options.text: It washes away dirt and debris that could hide virus particles

options.label: D
options.text: It is more expensive than hand sanitizer

multiple-choice.question: What is the recommended amount of time to wash your hands with soap and water?
What is the main difference between soap and hand sanitizer in terms of convenience?

options.label: A
options.text: Soap is more convenient to use on the go, while hand sanitizer is more convenient to use at home

options.label: B
options.text: Soap is more convenient to use at home, while hand sanitizer is more convenient to use on the go

options.label: C
options.text: Soap is more expensive than hand sanitizer, making it less convenient

options.label: D
options.text: Hand sanitizer is more expensive than soap, making it less convenient

multiple-choice.question: What is the recommended way to use hand sanitizer?

options.label: A
options.text: Rub your hands together until they are dry

options.label: B
options.text: Rub your hands together until they are wet

options.label: C
options.text: Apply hand sanitizer to your hands and let it sit for 20 seconds

options.label: D
options.text: Apply hand sanitizer to your hands and rub them together until they are dry

multiple-choice.question: What is a device that uses salt, water, and a car battery to make chlorinated water that kills harmful pathogens?

options.label: C
options.text: A device that uses salt, water, and a car battery to make chlorinated water that kills harmful pathogens

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between soap and hand sanitizer in terms of effectiveness against different types of viruses?

options.label: A
options.text: Soap is more effective against coronaviruses, while hand sanitizer is more effective against rhinoviruses

options.label: B
options.text: Soap is more effective against rhinoviruses, while hand sanitizer is more effective against coronaviruses

options.label: C
options.text: Soap and hand sanitizer are equally effective against all types of viruses

options.label: D
options.text: Soap and hand sanitizer are ineffective against all types of viruses

multiple-choice.question: What is the best way to determine which to use for any given outbreak?

options.label: A
options.text: Follow the advice of accredited medical professionals

options.label: B
options.text: Use soap and water for all outbreaks

options.label: C
options.text: Use hand sanitizer for all outbreaks

options.label: D
options.text: Use a combination of both soap and hand sanitizer for all outbreaks

title: This sea creature breathes through its butt - Cella Wright

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of sea cucumbers in their ecosystems?

options.label: A
options.text: They serve as a food source for other marine animals.

options.label: B
options.text: They clean and oxygenate the seafloor by breaking down detritus and recycling nutrients.

options.label: C
options.text: They provide shelter for other marine animals.

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of sea cucumbers?

options.label: B
options.text: They are radially symmetrical, "spiny-skinned" marine invertebrates.

options.label: C
options.text: They have a long, cylindrical shape.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the specialized tube feet in sea cucumbers?

options.label: A
options.text: They are used for locomotion and feeding.

options.label: B
options.text: They are used for respiration and feeding.

options.label: C
options.text: They are used for defense and reproduction.

options.label: D
options.text: They are used for sensory perception.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the internal lung-like structure in sea cucumbers that extracts oxygen from seawater?
What is the term for the process by which sea cucumbers expel their internal organs as a defense mechanism?
What is the purpose of the mutable collagenous tissue (MCT) in sea cucumbers?

options.label: A
options.text: It aids in efficient locomotion and enables sea cucumbers to fit into small spaces.

options.label: B
options.text: It is used for defense and reproduction.

options.label: C
options.text: It is used for respiration and feeding.

options.label: D
options.text: It is used for sensory perception.

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of sea cucumbers in coral formation?

options.label: A
options.text: They provide a source of nutrients for coral growth.

options.label: B
options.text: They aid in coral formation by providing a substrate for coral polyps to attach to.

options.label: C
options.text: They help to buffer marine environments from ocean acidification.

options.label: D
options.text: They do not play a role in coral formation.

multiple-choice.question: What is the estimated percentage of sandy seafloor that has passed through the digestive tract of a sea cucumber?
What is the primary function of the anus in sea cucumbers?

options.label: A
options.text: It is used for respiration and feeding.

options.label: B
options.text: It is used for defense and reproduction.

options.label: C
options.text: It is used for excretion and reproduction.

options.label: D
options.text: It is used for locomotion and feeding.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the species of sea cucumber that has five teeth around its anus?

title: Can you trust your eyes?

multiple-choice.question: What is the main topic of discussion in the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: The importance of the sense of smell in our perception of the world

options.label: B
options.text: The relationship between our vision and our perception of reality

options.label: C
options.text: The effects of color on our mood and emotions

options.label: D
options.text: The role of memory in shaping our understanding of the world

multiple-choice.question: What is the Munker-White illusion?

options.label: A
options.text: A type of optical illusion that involves the perception of color

options.label: B
options.text: A scientific theory that explains the nature of reality

options.label: C
options.text: A type of visual trickery that involves editing effects

options.label: D
options.text: A psychological phenomenon that affects our perception of time

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why our brains judge color and brightness in context?

options.label: A
options.text: To provide us with an absolute color or physical property of our external reality

options.label: B
options.text: To interpret what we see as efficiently as possible in order to interact with the environment most appropriately

options.label: C
options.text: To compare the surrounding environment with other objects in our field of vision

options.label: D
options.text: To create a sense of depth and distance in our visual perception

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of our senses, such as our eyes?

options.label: A
options.text: To provide us with an absolute color or physical property of our external reality

options.label: B
options.text: To interpret what we see as efficiently as possible in order to interact with the environment most appropriately

options.label: C
options.text: To compare the surrounding environment with other objects in our field of vision

options.label: D
options.text: To create a sense of depth and distance in our visual perception

multiple-choice.question: What is the tile illusion?

options.label: A
options.text: A type of optical illusion that involves the perception of color

options.label: B
options.text: A scientific theory that explains the nature of reality

options.label: C
options.text: A type of visual trickery that involves editing effects

options.label: D
options.text: A psychological phenomenon that affects our perception of time

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why our brains are tricked by the tile illusion?

options.label: A
options.text: Because our brains are not able to compare the surrounding environment with the tiles

options.label: B
options.text: Because our brains are not able to interpret the colors of the tiles accurately

options.label: C
options.text: Because our brains are not able to compensate for the shadows on the tiles

options.label: D
options.text: Because our brains are not able to interact with the environment most appropriately

multiple-choice.question: What is the gradient illusion?

options.label: A
options.text: A type of optical illusion that involves the perception of color

options.label: B
options.text: A scientific theory that explains the nature of reality

options.label: C
options.text: A type of visual trickery that involves editing effects

options.label: D
options.text: A psychological phenomenon that affects our perception of time

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why our brains are tricked by the gradient illusion?

options.label: A
options.text: Because our brains are not able to compare the surrounding environment with the gradient

options.label: B
options.text: Because our brains are not able to interpret the colors of the gradient accurately

options.label: C
options.text: Because our brains are not able to compensate for the darkness of the background

options.label: D
options.text: Because our brains are not able to interact with the environment most appropriately

multiple-choice.question: What is the main topic of discussion in the transcript's conclusion?

options.label: A
options.text: The importance of the sense of smell in our perception of the world

options.label: B
options.text: The relationship between our vision and our perception of reality

options.label: C
options.text: The effects of color on our mood and emotions

options.label: D
options.text: The role of memory in shaping our understanding of the world

multiple-choice.question: What is the main message of the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: Our perception of the world is absolute and not relative

options.label: B
options.text: Our perception of the world is relative and not absolute

options.label: C
options.text: Our perception of the world is a combination of both absolute and relative

options.label: D
options.text: Our perception of the world is not related to our vision

title: Fun cartoon on Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. for Kids!

multiple-choice.question: What was the name of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s father, who later changed his own name and his son's name too?
Where was Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. born?
At what age did Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. enter Morehouse College?
What was the name of the school where Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. met his future wife, Coretta Scott?
What event led to Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s involvement in the civil rights movement?
What was the title of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s famous speech delivered during the March on Washington?
In what year was Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. awarded the Nobel Peace Prize?
Where was Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. assassinated?
What federal holiday was created to honor Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s works?
In what year was President Ronald Reagan signed a bill creating a federal holiday to honor Dr. King's works?

title: Frederick Douglass for kids (cartoon biography)

multiple-choice.question: Who was the abolitionist mentioned in the transcript that was born a slave?
What was the name of the person who helped Frederick Douglass learn the basics of reading?
What was the law that prohibited slaves from reading during American history?

options.label: C
options.text: The law that prohibited slaves from reading

multiple-choice.question: What did Frederick Douglass do when he found out that his master was going to beat him for teaching other slaves to read?

options.label: A
options.text: He ran away to the North

options.label: B
options.text: He stood up to the beatings

options.label: D
options.text: He gave up teaching other slaves

multiple-choice.question: Where did Frederick Douglass escape to after he borrowed the papers of a free sailor?
What was the purpose of Frederick Douglass's biography?

options.label: C
options.text: To convince people to support the Civil War

options.label: D
options.text: To convince people to support the Union soldiers

multiple-choice.question: Who was the president that Frederick Douglass gave advice to during the Civil War?
What did Frederick Douglass convince President Abraham Lincoln to do during the Civil War?

options.label: A
options.text: To give more weapons to African Americans

options.label: B
options.text: To give more money to the Union soldiers

multiple-choice.question: Why did Frederick Douglass continue to speak out against slavery and the poor treatment of African Americans?

options.label: A
options.text: Because he wanted to be a famous leader

options.label: B
options.text: Because he wanted to live a free life

options.label: C
options.text: Because it was not acceptable to just go out and live a free life while others were being treated poorly

options.label: D
options.text: Because he was afraid of his master

multiple-choice.question: What will Frederick Douglass always be remembered for in African American History?

options.label: A
options.text: For escaping slavery and living a free life

options.label: B
options.text: For speaking out against slavery and the poor treatment of African Americans

options.label: C
options.text: For being a great leader in the Civil War

title: Watch this educational video for children with a Rosa Parks biography

multiple-choice.question: Where was Rosa Parks born?
What was the name of the group that Rosa Parks' grandfather protected their farm from?
What did the schools Rosa Parks attended have?

options.label: C
options.text: Separate schools for boys and girls

multiple-choice.question: Why did Rosa Parks leave school in the 11th grade?

options.label: A
options.text: To pursue a career in law

options.label: B
options.text: To help her sick mom and grandmother

multiple-choice.question: What was the name of the organization that Rosa Parks' husband was a part of?
What happened to Rosa Parks on December 1, 1955?

options.label: A
options.text: She was elected as the leader of the NAACP

options.label: B
options.text: She refused to move to a different seat on a bus

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of the Montgomery Boycott?

options.label: A
options.text: The city was forced to integrate the buses

options.label: B
options.text: The boycott lasted only a few days

options.label: C
options.text: The city was able to maintain its segregation laws

options.label: D
options.text: The boycott had no impact on the city

multiple-choice.question: Who was the other major person in African American History involved in the Montgomery Boycott?
When did Rosa Parks die?
What was the legacy of Rosa Parks?

options.label: A
options.text: She was a brave and courageous person who stood up against unfair treatment

title: Learn to read | Phonics for kids | Long vowels - OU and OY

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the ranch in the story?
What does the boy ask the two partners to do to become cowboys?
What sound do the two partners think they hear?
How many cows does the boy have at the beginning of the story?
What is the boy's goal at the end of the story?

options.label: C
options.text: To round up a thousand cows

multiple-choice.question: What type of animal does the boy say is on his ranch?
How many cows are left to round up at the end of the story?
What does the boy say is needed to round up cows?
What sound do the two partners think they finally hear?
What is the setting of the story?

title: 6 ways to start a sentence | Sentence structure | Learn to write

multiple-choice.question: What is the subject of a sentence?

options.label: A
options.text: A word that tells you what the subject is doing

options.label: B
options.text: A person, place, thing, or idea

options.label: C
options.text: A verb that follows the subject

options.label: D
options.text: A word that starts the sentence

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the best ways to start a sentence?

options.label: A
options.text: By using a doing word ending with ed

options.label: B
options.text: By putting the subject first and the verb second

options.label: C
options.text: By using an l y word

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of using a comma when starting a sentence with words that tell you where something is happening?

options.label: A
options.text: To separate the subject from the verb

options.label: B
options.text: To separate the subject from the object

options.label: C
options.text: To separate the location from the rest of the sentence

options.label: D
options.text: To separate the verb from the rest of the sentence

multiple-choice.question: What type of sentence can be started with words that tell you when something is happening?

options.label: D
options.text: A sentence that tells where or when something is happening

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of starting a sentence with a question?
What is the purpose of using a comma when starting a sentence with an action ending in ing?

options.label: A
options.text: To separate the subject from the verb

options.label: B
options.text: To separate the subject from the object

options.label: C
options.text: To separate the action from the rest of the sentence

options.label: D
options.text: To separate the verb from the rest of the sentence

multiple-choice.question: What type of words can be used to start a sentence?

options.label: D
options.text: Any type of word, including l y words

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of using l y words to start a sentence?

options.label: A
options.text: It makes the sentence sound boring

options.label: B
options.text: It makes the sentence sound exciting

options.label: D
options.text: It makes the sentence sound confusing

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of using a comma when starting a sentence with an l y word?

options.label: A
options.text: To separate the subject from the verb

options.label: B
options.text: To separate the subject from the object

options.label: C
options.text: To separate the action from the rest of the sentence

options.label: D
options.text: To separate the l y word from the rest of the sentence

multiple-choice.question: What is the benefit of using different ways to start a sentence?

title: Learn to read | Phonics for kids | Long U Vowels

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the city where Romeo and Juliet take place?
Who is the prince of Verona in Romeo and Juliet?
What is the name of Juliet's nurse?
What is the main reason for the feud between the Montagues and Capulets?

options.label: B
options.text: A disagreement over a business deal

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the potion that makes Juliet appear dead?
Who helps Romeo and Juliet get married in secret?
What is the name of the ball where Romeo and Juliet first meet?
Who kills Mercutio in a duel?
What is the reason for Romeo's banishment from Verona?

options.label: A
options.text: He killed Tybalt in a duel

options.label: B
options.text: He killed Mercutio in a duel

options.label: C
options.text: He killed Paris in a duel

options.label: D
options.text: He was involved in a fight with the Capulets

multiple-choice.question: What is the ultimate outcome of the tragic love story of Romeo and Juliet?

options.label: A
options.text: They get married and live happily ever after

options.label: B
options.text: They die in each other's arms

options.label: C
options.text: They are reunited in the afterlife

options.label: D
options.text: They become a king and queen
